result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Derek W Langan

records.addlTxt:
1:47 PM Attorney J Andrew Herbers Jr. in court for Derek W Langan. Defendant Derek W Langan in court. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marrufo.

Attorney Herbers requests a new date stating this matter should not have been put on the pre-trial calendar due to there being a victim.
Court adjourns and will set this matter for further proceedings before the assigned Judge.
Hearing scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on September 30, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with individuals listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

01:48 PM Defendant Derek W Langan in court, in custody, with attorney J Andrew Herbers.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal,  by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
